name: Crush Underfoot
text: Choose a Giant creature you control. It deals damage equal to its power to target creature.

editions.flavor:
Five-toed grave
—Kithkin phrase meaning
"a giant's footprint"

Five-toed grave
—Kithkin phrase meaning
"a giant's footprint"

name: Crux of Fate
text:
Choose one —
• Destroy all Dragon creatures.
• Destroy all non-Dragon creatures.

editions.flavor: Ugin's whispered summons led Sarkhan Vol to the moment that would echo down the centuries and seal Tarkir's fate: the primal battle between Ugin and Nicol Bolas.

name: Cryoclasm
text: Destroy target Plains or Island. Cryoclasm deals 3 damage to that land's controller.

editions.flavor: The people of Terisiare had come to live on frozen fields as though on solid ground. Nothing reminded them of the difference more clearly than the rifts brought on by the Thaw.
The people of Terisiare had come to live on frozen fields as though on solid ground. Nothing reminded them of the difference more clearly than the rifts brought on by the Thaw.

name: Cry of Contrition
text:
Target player discards a card.
Haunt (When this spell card is put into a graveyard after resolving, exile it haunting target creature.)
When the creature Cry of Contrition haunts dies, target player discards a card.

name: Crypsis
text: Target creature you control gains protection from creatures your opponents control until end of turn. Untap it.

editions.flavor: Tritons borrow the camouflage of their oceanic prey to become predators on land.

name: Crypt Angel
text:
Flying, protection from white
When Crypt Angel enters the battlefield, return target blue or red creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor: Once an angel, now an abomination.

name: Cryptborn Horror
text:
Trample
Cryptborn Horror enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it, where X is the total life lost by your opponents this turn.

editions.flavor: Although Cryptwitch Merree vanished after a spat with Rakdos, her playthings lingered.

name: Cryptbreaker
text:
{1}{B}, {T}, Discard a card: Create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.
Tap three untapped Zombies you control: You draw a card and you lose 1 life.

name: Crypt Champion
text:
Double strike
When Crypt Champion enters the battlefield, each player puts a creature card with converted mana cost 3 or less from his or her graveyard onto the battlefield.
When Crypt Champion enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless {R} was spent to cast it.

name: Crypt Cobra
text: Whenever Crypt Cobra attacks and isn't blocked, defending player gets a poison counter. (A player with ten or more poison counters loses the game.)

name: Crypt Creeper
text: Sacrifice Crypt Creeper: Exile target card from a graveyard.

editions.flavor: To unearth its dinner, it inters itself.

"I guess what they say is true. What doesn't kill you makes you stronger. Or at least stranger."
—Captain Eberhart

name: Crypt Ghast
text:
Extort (Whenever you cast a spell, you may pay {W/B}. If you do, each opponent loses 1 life and you gain that much life.)
Whenever you tap a Swamp for mana, add {B} to your mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).

name: Cryptic Annelid
text: When Cryptic Annelid enters the battlefield, scry 1, then scry 2, then scry 3. (To scry X, look at the top X cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

name: Cryptic Command
text:
Choose two —
• Counter target spell.
• Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
• Tap all creatures your opponents control.
• Draw a card.

name: Cryptic Cruiser
text:
Devoid (This card has no color.)
{2}{U}, Put a card an opponent owns from exile into that player's graveyard: Tap target creature.

editions.flavor: "The seas are no less imperiled than the dry lands. This fight is mine as much as it is yours."—Kiora, to Gideon Jura

name: Cryptic Gateway
text: Tap two untapped creatures you control: You may put a creature card from your hand that shares a creature type with each creature tapped this way onto the battlefield.

editions.flavor: Its lock changes to fit each key.

name: Crypt Incursion
text: Exile all creature cards from target player's graveyard. You gain 3 life for each card exiled this way.

editions.flavor: The Golgari maze-runner Varolz hungers to prove his fortitude in battle, and his trail of victims feeds other hungers.

name: Crypt of Agadeem
text:
Crypt of Agadeem enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.
{2}, {T}: Add {B} to your mana pool for each black creature card in your graveyard.

name: Cryptolith Fragment
text:
Cryptolith Fragment enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. Each player loses 1 life.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if each player has 10 or less life, transform Cryptolith Fragment.

name: Cryptolith Rite
text: Creatures you control have "{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool."

editions.flavor: The chant was incomprehensible, but its power was unmistakable.

name: Cryptoplasm
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may have Cryptoplasm become a copy of another target creature. If you do, Cryptoplasm gains this ability.

editions.flavor:
"If left in the enemy's shape too long, it might be lost to them."
—Vy Covalt, Neurok agent

name: Crypt Rats
text: {X}: Crypt Rats deals X damage to each creature and each player. Spend only black mana on X.

editions.flavor:
"Once I dreamt of death, but now it dreams of me / And only rats and rotting flesh can hear my silent plea."
—Mundungu chant

Beware anything born among the dead.
—Tolarian saying

name: Crypt Ripper
text:
Haste
{B}: Crypt Ripper gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: The tender light of the living quickens the pulse of the dead.

name: Crypt Sliver
text: All Slivers have "{T}: Regenerate target Sliver."

editions.flavor:
"Death couldn't contain the slivers. What made us think we could?"
—Riptide Project researcher

name: Cryptwailing
text: {1}, Exile two creature cards from your graveyard: Target player discards a card. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

editions.flavor:
"Piece the tragic notes together and is it not a melody?"
—Teysa

name: Crystal Ball
text: {1}, {T}: Scry 2. (Look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

editions.flavor: It glints with arcane truths to those who know how to glimpse them.

name: Crystal Chimes
text: {3}, {T}, Sacrifice Crystal Chimes: Return all enchantment cards from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor: As Serra was to learn, the peace and sanctity of her realm were as fragile as glass.
As Serra was to learn, the peace and sanctity of her realm were as fragile as glass.

name: Crystal Golem
text: At the beginning of your end step, Crystal Golem phases out. (While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist. It phases in before you untap during your next untap step.)

editions.flavor:
"Once, a wealthy king commissioned an artificial creature to be crafted from the royal treasury, thinking it a clever ploy to have the jewels guard themselves."
—Azeworai, "The Golem's Wish"

name: Crystalline Crawler
text:
Converge — Crystalline Crawler enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each color of mana spent to cast it.
Remove a +1/+1 counter from Crystalline Crawler: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
{T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Crystalline Crawler.

name: Crystalline Nautilus
text:
Bestow {3}{U}{U} (If you cast this card for its bestow cost, it's an Aura spell with enchant creature. It becomes a creature again if it's not attached to a creature.)
When Crystalline Nautilus becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it.
Enchanted creature gets +4/+4 and has "When this creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it."

name: Crystalline Sliver
text: All Slivers have shroud. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities.)

editions.flavor: Bred as living shields, these slivers have proven unruly—they know they cannot be caught.
Bred as living shields, these slivers have proven unruly-they know they cannot be caught.
Bred as living shields, these slivers have proven unruly—they know they cannot be caught.
Bred as living shields, these slivers have proven unruly—they know they cannot be caught.

name: Crystallization
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.
When enchanted creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, exile that creature.

name: Crystal Quarry
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{5}, {T}: Add {W}{U}{B}{R}{G} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor:
"How tragic that greed eclipses beauty."
—Seton, centaur druid

name: Crystal Rod
text: Whenever a player casts a blue spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

editions.flavor: Polished by a thousand waves.
Polished by a thousand waves.

name: Crystal Seer
text:
When Crystal Seer enters the battlefield, look at the top four cards of your library, then put them back in any order.
{4}{U}: Return Crystal Seer to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: "Surprise is a useless, untidy emotion—the plaything of goblins and fools."

name: Crystal Shard
text: {3}, {T} or {U}, {T}: Return target creature to its owner's hand unless its controller pays {1}.

editions.flavor: The vedalken know it is not of this world, so they know that this world is not the only one.

name: Crystal Spray
text:
Change the text of target spell or permanent by replacing all instances of one color word with another or one basic land type with another until end of turn.
Draw a card.

name: Crystal Vein
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Crystal Vein: Add {C}{C} to your mana pool.

name: Cudgel Troll
text: {G}: Regenerate Cudgel Troll. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

name: Culling Dais
text:
{T}, Sacrifice a creature: Put a charge counter on Culling Dais.
{1}, Sacrifice Culling Dais: Draw a card for each charge counter on Culling Dais.

editions.flavor:
"Forswear the flesh and you will truly see."
—Jin-Gitaxias, Core Augur

"Forswear the flesh and you will truly see."
—Jin-Gitaxias, Core Augur

name: Culling Drone
text:
Devoid (This card has no color.)
Ingest (Whenever this creature deals combat damage to a player, that player exiles the top card of his or her library.)

editions.flavor: Silence rules Bala Ged, broken only by the skittering of Eldrazi.

name: Culling Mark
text: Target creature blocks this turn if able.

editions.flavor: Hunt without Nylea's leave and you may find yourself the next quarry.

name: Culling Scales
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, destroy target nonland permanent with the lowest converted mana cost. (If two or more permanents are tied for lowest cost, target any one of them.)

name: Culling Sun
text: Destroy each creature with converted mana cost 3 or less.

editions.flavor:
"Who truly runs this city? Look to the sky on hallowed days, and see whose sigil is stamped clearly onto the heavens."
—Vuliev of the Ghost Council

name: Culling the Weak
text:
As an additional cost to cast Culling the Weak, sacrifice a creature.
Add {B}{B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor:
"The blood of the weak shall be the ink with which we scribe great Yawgmoth's glorious name."
—Stronghold architect, journal

name: Cultbrand Cinder
text: When Cultbrand Cinder enters the battlefield, put a -1/-1 counter on target creature.

editions.flavor: "Your seared flesh will be the first step in your journey to dark enlightenment."

name: Cultist's Staff
text:
Equipped creature gets +2/+2.
Equip {3} ({3}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

editions.flavor: The head of the staff doubles as a brand to anoint the newly inducted.

name: Cultivate
text: Search your library for up to two basic land cards, reveal those cards, and put one onto the battlefield tapped and the other into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor: All seeds share a common bond, calling to each other across infinity.
All seeds share a common bond, calling to each other across infinity.
All seeds share a common bond, calling to each other across infinity.
All seeds share a common bond, calling to each other across infinity.
All seeds share a common bond, calling to each other across infinity.
All seeds share a common bond, calling to each other across infinity.
All seeds share a common bond, calling to each other across infinity.

name: Cultivator Drone
text:
Devoid (This card has no color.)
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast a colorless spell, activate an ability of a colorless permanent, or pay a cost that contains {C}. ({C} represents colorless mana.)

name: Cultivator of Blades
text:
Fabricate 2 (When this creature enters the battlefield, put two +1/+1 counters on it or create two 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature tokens.)
Whenever Cultivator of Blades attacks, you may have other attacking creatures get +X/+X until end of turn, where X is Cultivator of Blades's power.

name: Cultivator's Caravan
text:
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
Crew 3 (Tap any number of creatures you control with total power 3 or more: This Vehicle becomes an artifact creature until end of turn.)

name: Cult of the Waxing Moon
text: Whenever a permanent you control transforms into a non-Human creature, create a 2/2 green Wolf creature token.

editions.flavor: In times of madness, people cling to the familiar, monstrous though it may be.

name: Cultural Exchange
text: Choose any number of creatures target player controls. Choose the same number of creatures another target player controls. Those players exchange control of those creatures. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

name: Cumber Stone
text: Creatures your opponents control get -1/-0.

editions.flavor:
"The stone is more potent than ever. The flesh that creeps into our land will become even more slovenly and weak."
—Niclavs, archmage of Esper

name: Cunning
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.
When enchanted creature attacks or blocks, sacrifice Cunning at the beginning of the next cleanup step.

editions.flavor:
". . . Dry-walkers die
We feed on sweet flesh . . . ."
—Rootwater Saga

name: Cunning Advisor
text: {T}: Target opponent discards a card. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

name: Cunning Bandit
text:
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may put a ki counter on Cunning Bandit.
At the beginning of the end step, if there are two or more ki counters on Cunning Bandit, you may flip it.

name: Cunning Breezedancer
text:
Flying
Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, Cunning Breezedancer gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"That which is beautiful in form can also be deadly."
—Ishai, Ojutai dragonspeaker

name: Cunning Giant
text: If Cunning Giant is unblocked, you may have it assign its combat damage to a creature defending player controls.

name: Cunning Lethemancer
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, each player discards a card.

editions.flavor: "Give me your memories, and you will have release from the suffering they bring you."

name: Cunning Sparkmage
text:
Haste
{T}: Cunning Sparkmage deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor: "I see the weaknesses you hide even from yourself."

name: Cunning Strike
text:
Cunning Strike deals 2 damage to target creature and 2 damage to target player.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"The opponent who blocks the path, becomes the path."
—Shu Yun, the Silent Tempest

name: Cunning Wish
text: You may choose an instant card you own from outside the game, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Exile Cunning Wish.

editions.flavor: He wished for knowledge, but not for the will to apply it.
The foolish wish for that which they desire. The cunning wish for that which they require.

name: Cuombajj Witches
text: {T}: Cuombajj Witches deals 1 damage to target creature or player and 1 damage to target creature or player of an opponent's choice.

name: Curfew
text: Each player returns a creature he or she controls to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: ". . . But I'm not tired!"
". . . But I'm not tired!"

name: Curiosity
text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage to an opponent, you may draw a card.

editions.flavor: All Mirri wanted to do was rest, but she couldn't ignore a nagging suspicion as she followed Crovax's skulking form.
All Mirri wanted to do was rest, but she couldn't ignore a nagging suspicion as she followed Crovax's skulking form.
"You know that secret? The one that wakes you up at night in a cold sweat? The one you think no one else in the world knows? Well, guess what."
"Surely you know the joy of the hunt, my furry friend. My kind of hunt just takes a different form than yours."

name: Curious Homunculus
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast an instant or sorcery spell.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if there are three or more instant and/or sorcery cards in your graveyard, transform Curious Homunculus.

editions.flavor: "Step right up! Try your hand! It'll thrill the senses and boggle the mind!"

name: Curse Artifact
text:
Enchant artifact
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted artifact's controller, Curse Artifact deals 2 damage to that player unless he or she sacrifices that artifact.

editions.flavor: Voska feared the artifact had come too easily.

name: Cursebreak
text: Destroy target enchantment. You gain 2 life.

editions.flavor: No longer the village pariah. No longer taunted and shamed. Sigrun was finally free.

name: Cursecatcher
text: Sacrifice Cursecatcher: Counter target instant or sorcery spell unless its controller pays {1}.

editions.flavor: "Of all the things that can be stolen, opportunity is the most valuable."

name: Cursed Flesh
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -1/-1 and has fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

editions.flavor: A farewell to arms . . . and feet . . . and legs . . .
Misery, filth, disease—all things that bring suffering to the world—only make Phyrexians more dangerous.
A farewell to arms . . . and feet . . . and legs . . . .

name: Cursed Land
text:
Enchant land
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted land's controller, Cursed Land deals 1 damage to that player.

name: Cursed Monstrosity
text:
Flying
Whenever Cursed Monstrosity becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it unless you discard a land card.

editions.flavor:
"Run away! It's an . . . um . . . run away!"
—Nomad sentry

name: Cursed Rack
text:
As Cursed Rack enters the battlefield, choose an opponent.
The chosen player's maximum hand size is four.

editions.flavor: Ashnod invented several torture techniques that could make victims even miles away beg for mercy as if the End had come.
Ashnod invented several torture techniques that could make victims even miles away beg for mercy as if the End had come.
Ashnod invented several torture techniques that could make victims even miles away beg for mercy as if the End had come.

name: Cursed Ronin
text:
Bushido 1 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
{B}: Cursed Ronin gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "You are fortunate, my enemy. You have paid the price but once. I never stop paying."

name: Cursed Scroll
text: {3}, {T}: Name a card. Reveal a card at random from your hand. If it's the named card, Cursed Scroll deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

name: Cursed Totem
text: Activated abilities of creatures can't be activated.

editions.flavor:
Pass me from soul to soul, / soldier to herder, herder to beast, beast to soil / until I am everywhere. / Then pass me those souls.
—Totem inscription (translated)

Pass me from soul to soul / soldier to herder, herder to beast, beast to soil / until I am everywhere. / Then pass me those souls.
—Totem inscription (translated)

name: Curse of Bloodletting
text:
Enchant player
If a source would deal damage to enchanted player, it deals double that damage to that player instead.

editions.flavor: It is the demon's mark, an infernal claim on the flesh of the guilty.

name: Curse of Chains
text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of each upkeep, tap enchanted creature.

editions.flavor: The giant's real punishment was the fleeting moment when he was allowed to stand before being dragged down to his knees again.

name: Curse of Chaos
text:
Enchant player
Whenever a player attacks enchanted player with one or more creatures, that attacking player may discard a card. If the player does, he or she draws a card.

editions.flavor:
"Let them cry for mercy. The only one who can hear them is me."
—Siglind the Conqueror

name: Curse of Death's Hold
text:
Enchant player
Creatures enchanted player controls get -1/-1.

editions.flavor: "May you and all your kin waste and wither until your clan is no more!"

name: Curse of Echoes
text:
Enchant player
Whenever enchanted player casts an instant or sorcery spell, each other player may copy that spell and may choose new targets for the copy he or she controls.

name: Curse of Exhaustion
text:
Enchant player
Enchanted player can't cast more than one spell each turn.

editions.flavor:
"I do believe your heresy will prove more difficult now that you have more pressing concerns."
—Bishop Argust

name: Curse of Inertia
text:
Enchant player
Whenever a player attacks enchanted player with one or more creatures, that attacking player may tap or untap target permanent of his or her choice.

editions.flavor:
"As long as I pull the strings, you will dance."
—Tezzeret

name: Curse of Marit Lage
text:
When Curse of Marit Lage enters the battlefield, tap all Islands.
Islands don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.

editions.flavor:
"Our world has not felt her thundering steps in lifetimes, but Marit Lage's presence is still with us."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran Priest

name: Curse of Misfortunes
text:
Enchant player
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may search your library for a Curse card that doesn't have the same name as a Curse attached to enchanted player, put it onto the battlefield attached to that player, then shuffle your library.

name: Curse of Oblivion
text:
Enchant player
At the beginning of enchanted player's upkeep, that player exiles two cards from his or her graveyard.

editions.flavor: The first step to peace is to learn how to forget.

name: Curse of Predation
text:
Enchant player
Whenever a creature attacks enchanted player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

editions.flavor:
"Hunters feed on the fear of their prey."
—Garruk Wildspeaker

name: Curse of Shallow Graves
text:
Enchant player
Whenever a player attacks enchanted player with one or more creatures, that attacking player may create a tapped 2/2 black Zombie creature token.

name: Curse of Stalked Prey
text:
Enchant player
Whenever a creature deals combat damage to enchanted player, put a +1/+1 counter on that creature.

editions.flavor:
"Innocent thorns can fill the air with your bloodscent. Don't stray from the path."
—Elmut, crossway watcher

name: Curse of the Bloody Tome
text:
Enchant player
At the beginning of enchanted player's upkeep, that player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

editions.flavor: After seeing his life's work drip away, the mage decided it was a good time to go crazy.
After seeing his life's work drip away, the mage decided it was a good time to go crazy.

name: Curse of the Cabal
text:
Target player sacrifices half the permanents he or she controls, rounded down.
Suspend 2—{2}{B}{B} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay {2}{B}{B} and exile it with two time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost.)
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, if Curse of the Cabal is suspended, that player may sacrifice a permanent. If he or she does, put two time counters on Curse of the Cabal.

name: Curse of the Fire Penguin
text:
Curse of the Fire Penguin consumes and confuses enchanted creature.
-----
Creature Penguin
Trample
When this creature is put into a graveyard from play, return Curse of the Fire Penguin from your graveyard to play.
6/5

name: Curse of the Forsaken
text:
Enchant player
Whenever a creature attacks enchanted player, its controller gains 1 life.

editions.flavor:
"Purge the damned, for they have no place among the righteous!"
—Seeta of Thraben

name: Curse of the Nightly Hunt
text:
Enchant player
Creatures enchanted player controls attack each turn if able.

editions.flavor: When the moon rises and the bloodlust takes hold, nothing matters but the kill.
When the moon rises and the bloodlust takes hold, nothing matters but the kill.

name: Curse of the Pierced Heart
text:
Enchant player
At the beginning of enchanted player's upkeep, Curse of the Pierced Heart deals 1 damage to that player.

editions.flavor:
"May your veins weep, and may every vampire take notice."
—Stensian curse

name: Curse of the Swine
text: Exile X target creatures. For each creature exiled this way, its controller creates a 2/2 green Boar creature token.

editions.flavor: Another imminent battle subsided in busy snuffling and carefree rooting.

name: Curse of Thirst
text:
Enchant player
At the beginning of enchanted player's upkeep, Curse of Thirst deals damage to that player equal to the number of Curses attached to him or her.

editions.flavor:
"May you drink until you drown but never be sated."
—Odila, witch of Morkrut

"May you drink until you drown but never be sated."
—Odila, witch of Morkrut

name: Curse of Vengeance
text:
Enchant player
Whenever enchanted player casts a spell, put a spite counter on Curse of Vengeance.
When enchanted player loses the game, you gain X life and draw X cards, where X is the number of spite counters on Curse of Vengeance.
